clinical_study.official_title: Improving Care for Cardiovascular Disease in China: A Collaborative Project of AHA and CSC (CCC Project) - Atrial Fibrillation

lead_sponsor.agency: Beijing Institute of Heart, Lung and Blood Vessel Diseases

clinical_study.source: Beijing Institute of Heart, Lung and Blood Vessel Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop and implement quality improvement programs for the treatment of atrial fibrillation (AF) in China based on the successful experience of the AHA‚ÄêGet with the Guidelines program. This two-year program will use data collection, analysis, feedback, and process improvement to extend the use of evidence-based guidelines throughout the healthcare system and improve patient care of atrial fibrillation.

primary_outcome.measure: The overall composite of six performance measures for AF care
primary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 1 week
primary_outcome.description: Performance measures for AF care including: Proportion of patients received assessment of thromboembolic risk factors Proportion of patients discharged on warfarin or other anticoagulant drug Proportion of patients discharged on warfarin who have PT/INR follow-up planned prior to hospital discharge Proportion of patients with left ventricular systolic dysfunction prescribed an ACEI or ARB at hospital discharge Proportion of patients with left ventricular systolic dysfunction prescribed a beta blocker at hospital discharge Proportion of patients with either coronary artery disease, cerebrovascular accident/transient ischemic attack, peripheral vascular disease or diabetes who were prescribed a statin at hospital discharge
